reviewText: The wit and unexpected humor of "They Call Me Trinity" was sadly marred by poor color and audio, despite a strong plot and intriguing religious subtext.Trinity is a fast, but relaxed gun fighter, and his brother is a lazy horse thief pretending to be a sheriff to hide his crimes. Both protect a community of Mormons (who act like Amish) who do not believe in violence.Trinity is lot like Eastwood/Blondie inThe Good, the Bad and the Ugly, with a certain James Bond charm. He is not the usual brash gunman, but is twice and tough, and twice as sweet. A great character.In the spaghetti western tradition, mimicking "The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly," this film has all Italian cast. The dubbing didn't cut it, as it seemed imposed on the movie more than it was integrated.I'd like to see the series remade. It is that much fun.I recommend "They Call Me Trinity." The movie is funny, and worth renting, but buying it is only for the true fans of the genre.Anthony Trendleditor, HungarianBookstore.com

reviewText: This is a spoof of the typical western movie where the good guy is the fastest gun.  It pokes fun at these westerns in a good natured way.  It is one of the few movies I can watch over and over.  The movie is very funny.  About 3/4 of the way into the movie, it gets a little slow, but the end makes up for it.  You will enjoy this movie if you like westerns and comedy.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Several years before the classic Blazing Saddles, the Trinity movies were blazing their own trails into western comedy.  Shiftless, dirty and lazy Trinity rides into town on his back on a makeshift bed dragged by his horse.  He meets up with his outlaw brother who encourages him to do something with his life, such as become a horse thief like he is.  His reply is that he is just too busy doing nothing!  He and his brother are both the fastest guns in the west.  His brother shoots 3 men before they can even unholster their weapons.  Trinity too is very fast on the draw and shoots people coming up behind him or above him with lightening speed.  Sounds a bit violent, but their speed and ability to fight with superhuman strength is amusing and funny at times.  When I first saw this movie years ago I thought it was the funniest thing I had ever seen, but it doesn't quite stand up well over time.  Decent plot involving a bad guy trying to drive Mormon farmers out of a valley that he wants for his horses.  A couple of minor surprises here and there and some funny stuff.  Nice title song too. Well worth owning as a classic to watch now and then when you want something a bit light.  Easy to follow the plot without paying close attention.  Probably okay for the kids too, except for the shootings, although they see plenty of that on TV anyway, so nothing new here.  Probably would be a PG rating if it was rated today.

reviewText: This is a great movie and quite different from Boot Hill. Terence Hill and Bud Spencer play half brothers. Hill is the buster and honest, Spencer plays the not quite as bright strong bull.  From start to finish the movie is hilarious, taking the Eastwood spaghetti westerns to a whole different level, with gun slinging hundreds of times faster, slapstick shots at rather dim gangsters and general comedic nudges at the whole genre.  This movie started it all.  Enjoyable and a must for Trinity and spaghetti western fans.
summary: The Birth of the Trinity Slapsticks

reviewText: Great spaghetti Western, but with a twist, a comedic twist. It's old but still brings a laugh. I still remember the patented Bud Spencer thunk on the head. The surgery scene was priceless where the knife was heat disinfected and then wiped across Bud's never washed shirt, or the patient becoming an alcoholic, or Terence Hill pulling his dirty clothes back on after the soak. Just introduced this to the latest generation of our family. Tanks for the memories.

reviewText: Hill`s character is called Trinity, the left hand of the devil. He and his brother are by far the fastest guns in the west in thisfunny spoof of the old west. His brother is a not quite "hardened" outlaw and Trinity, while not completely opposed to being anoutlaw, is really too lazy and fun loving (his idea of fun is more than a little off the beaten path) to be much of anythingexcept a bum.They run across a batch of pacifist farmers who are being victimized by real hardened outlaws, and somehow manage to become thegood guys of the film with plenty of laughs along the way. The plot is not that good and neither is the acting, but somehow thatjust makes it that much more funny.Definately a B movie, but a fun one.
summary: Definately a "B" western, but a fun "B" western

reviewText: They Call Me Trinity is a story of two outlaw brothers who pose as sheriff and deputy of a small town and end up saving some local Mormon farmers from the harassment of an evil Major and a Mexican bandit and his gang.A spaghetti western classic to be sure, but it's different from the films that came before it-different in the fact that it's a bit more lighthearted and comical.  I don't consider it so much of a spoof , but rather just a zanier version of the genre.  It is a spaghetti western.  Sure, the violence it a bit more toned down(the final battle isn't a shootout, but a huge brawl), but Trinity isn't above blowing someone away if he has to.The Italian comic duo of Hill and Spencer is at a high point here.  While I didn't find the film to be sidesplitting hilarious, it was a good story, and Hill and Spencer have some good chemistry.  They ought to considering how many films they did together.  I always thought of Hill as a kind of slapstick Franco Nero.Many thought that this film brought on the death of the spaghetti western, much as in the way that people think that Abbott and Costello Meets Frankenstein was the death of the Universal horror films.  I suppose that once a genre goes on long enough and starts making them into comedies to breathe new life into it, it's a sign of the end.  The spaghetti western would get a mini revival a few years later, but whether or not Trinity was a last grasp at the genre, I think it ended up being very good.  So did a few other folks coz they made a sequel.

reviewText: This review is on the HENS TOOTH DVD.The DVD is very, very bad. It may be a nice new colorful scan, but the company utilized a PAL digibeta (hence the French titles) and this results in the film being sped up by five minutes. This does not mean the film is cut, it's just the PAL speedup that makes it five minutes shorter because it's 25fps (albiet, with pulldown to 29fps). The release is also plagued with interlacing artifacts (no it's not a progressive video). Everything about it is just awful. Hopefully a "proper" release will come out soon. The only good thing about the release is the gallery and the clear English audio track.The movie, however, is a hit! Terence Hill and Bud Spencer make a great duo and the score really brings the film together. It's a must see Spaghetti Western.
summary: Hens Tooth should have done more work...

reviewText: I LOVE spaghetti westerns! They give the genre the treatment it deserves!The characters (many with absurdly big beards!) are sometimes so dirty and unhygenic you can smell them! (such as when the guy is eating baked beans out of a frying pan which looks like it's never been cleaned!)Tongue in cheek as only the italians can produce - a great laugh all the way!
summary: Soylent Dick says: Spaghetti Movies Yes!!!!
